intro: Rochelia mirheydari, commonly known as the Persian sand thorn, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and spiny, woody stems. The plant is adapted to harsh environments, with deep roots that allow it to survive in sandy soils. It plays a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing soil erosion in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological importance, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
